comment.text: Single-stranded DNA-specific cytidine deaminase. Involved in somatic hypermutation (SHM), gene conversion, and class-switch recombination (CSR) in B-lymphocytes by deaminating C to U during transcription of Ig-variable (V) and Ig-switch (S) region DNA. Required for several crucial steps of B-cell terminal differentiation necessary for efficient antibody responses (PubMed:18722174, PubMed:21385873, PubMed:21518874, PubMed:27716525). May also play a role in the epigenetic regulation of gene expression by participating in DNA demethylation (PubMed:21496894).

reaction.text: a 2'-deoxycytidine in a single-stranded DNA + H(+) + H2O = a 2'-deoxyuridine in a single-stranded DNA + NH4(+)

comment.text: Interacts with CTNNBL1; the interaction is important for the immunoglobulin switch activity of AICDA (PubMed:18722174, PubMed:21385873). Interacts (via its NLS) with KPNA1. Interacts with PKA/PRKACA and PRKAR1A/PKR1 (PubMed:16387847). Interacts with TRIM28 and NCL (By similarity). Interacts with SUPT6H (PubMed:21518874). Interacts with RNF126 (PubMed:23277564). Directly interacts with MCM3AP; this interaction may favor AICDA recruitment to immunoglobulin variable region genes, hence promoting somatic hypermutations (PubMed:20507984).
Predominantly cytoplasmic (PubMed:21385873). In the presence of MCM3AP/GANP, relocalizes to the nucleus (By similarity).
Strongly expressed in lymph nodes and tonsils.
Ser-38 is the major site whereas Thr-27 is the minor site of phosphorylation. Phosphorylation regulates its class-switch recombination activity.
Probably monoubiquitinated on several residues by RNF126.

disease.name: Immunodeficiency with hyper-IgM 2
disease.description: A rare immunodeficiency syndrome characterized by normal or elevated serum IgM levels with absence of IgG, IgA, and IgE. It results in a profound susceptibility to bacterial infections.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the cytidine and deoxycytidylate deaminase family.

property.value: Expressed in tonsil and 89 other tissues
P:negative regulation of DNA methylation-dependent heterochromatin assembly
P:negative regulation of single stranded viral RNA replication via double stranded DNA intermediate
P:regulation of nuclear cell cycle DNA replication

feature.description: In HIGM2; completely abolishes nuclear import and interaction with CTNNBL1, diminishes interaction with KPNA1 and abolishes immunoglobulin class switching; dbSNP:rs104894324.
In HIGM2; unknown pathological significance; loss of mutagenic activity.
In HIGM2; unknown pathological significance; dbSNP:rs762590894.
In HIGM2; slightly decreased mutagenic activity.
Little effect on nuclear import; when associated with A-193. No effect on CTNNBL1 binding.
Greatly impaired nuclear import; when associated with V-19 and A-193. Reduced interaction with both CTNNBL1 and KPNA1, and abolishes immunoglobulin class switching; when associated with V-19.
Greatly impaired nuclear import; when associated with S-18 and A-193. Reduced interaction with both CTNNBL1 and KPNA1, and abolishes immunoglobulin class switching; when associated with S-18.
Impaired nuclear import; when associated with A-193. No effect on CTNNBL1 binding.
Loss of phosphorylation. No effect on cytidine deaminase activity. Impaired class-switch recombination activity.
Phosphomimetic mutant which shows loss of cytidine deaminase activity and impaired class-switch recombination activity.
Loss of phosphorylation. Impaired class-switch recombination activity. No effect on interaction with CTNNBL1.
No effect on interaction with CTNNBL1.
Greatly reduced interaction with CTNNBL1 but no effect on subcellular location, enzyme activity, ability to oligomerize nor on phosphorylation at Ser-38. Diminished antibody diversification.
Some reduced nuclear import; when associated with A-193.
Greatly reduced nuclear import; when associated with A-193.

Completely abolishes nuclear import; when associated with W-24 or D-112. Little affect on nuclear import; when associated with A-10. Greatly impaired nuclear import; when associated with K-20 or G-50. Almost completely abolishes nuclear import; when associated with S-18 and V-19.
